parsed.internal_thinking: I currently have 1 Ore, 1 Sheep, and 2 Wheat. My immediate goal is to expand towards the 3:1 port at node 51 to improve my trading flexibility, especially since my Ore production is limited to the low-probability O2 hex at node 44. To build a road and settlement, I need Wood and Brick, which I am currently lacking (producing on W11 and B6). AI_2 is the only player with Wood and Brick right now, but they are likely to use them for their own expansion. Since I can't build any structures or upgrade to a city (which requires 3 Ore), buying a development card is the most strategic move. It could grant me a Knight for future board control, a Victory Point, or a progress card like Road Building or Year of Plenty that would accelerate my path to the port. I'll spend 1 Ore, 1 Sheep, and 1 Wheat to buy a card, leaving me with 1 Wheat for future use. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Priority remains reaching the 3:1 port at node 51. Need Wood and Brick. If the dev card is a Road Building, use it immediately to reach node 51. If it's a Knight, hold it to protect my high-value Wheat hexes (6, 9) or the B6 hex. Continue monitoring AI_2's expansion near the southern ports.
parsed.say_outloud: The dice haven't been too kind with the building materials lately, so I'm going to see if a development card can give me a bit of an edge. Good luck on the next rolls, everyone!
